Question: What is the logical order of the 5 Process Groups?

Answers: Planning, Initiating, Executing, Monitoring and Controlling, Closing.
Initiating, Planning, Monitoring and Controlling, Executing, Closing.
Initiating, Executing, Planning, Monitoring and Controlling, Closing.
Initiating, Planning, Executing, Monitoring and Controlling, Closing.

Question: In project initiating process group, which statement describes best handling of the assumptions
Note: [Qno: PML_538] >> PMBOK(r) Guide 4th Edition, pages 77 and 78 (outputs of process Develop project charter).

Answers: It is the responsibility of the presales person, so don’t bother about it
Managing and organizing assumptions means avoiding risks right from the start of the project.
Organizational, environmental and external assumptions should be addressed in the project charter.
Assumptions are sign for risk which will come when project will be executed. So you can wait till risk planning phase start.

Question: In the context of progressive elaboration of project scope, which statement is not appropriate

It means developing in steps. It not should be confused with scope creep.
It signals a weak spot in the scope definition process, caused by incomplete contracts and specifications.
If managed properly, it integrates elaboration of project and deliverable specifications.

Note: [Qno: PML_621] >> Regular plant maintenance is operational activity.

Question: You are using a Phase gate approach for your project. What do you need to consider?

Answers: Gates are often called kill points, when they are used to eliminate weak team members.
Phase gates are often used to verify entry criteria of a previous phase and exit criteria of the next one.
The order of phases must be strictly consecutive without overlapping in order to allow for gates.
If phase gate is approaching fast then it is a sign of poor planning

Question: Projects are undertaken at all levels of the organization?

The following best describes this situation:

Answers: This is project management , they are working using agile methodology
This is operations management. Since this is ongoing activity in the organization.
This is portfolio management since each product release is a program in itself.
This is program management since each release is separate project and individual project’s release impacts the product release.

Question: In an interview you asked PMP certified project manager that what is the most important characteristics of project manager. He replied that he should be
Note: [Qno: PML_2486] >> In the project management context, integration includes characteristics of unification, consolidation, articulation, and integrative actions that are crucial to project completion, successfully managing stakeholder expectations, and meeting requirements.
